benchmark_details.name: ToTER (Topical Taxonomy Enhanced Retrieval)
benchmark_details.overview: ToTER is a framework that enhances PLM-based retrieval in theme-specific applications using a corpus topical taxonomy to identify central topics of queries and documents, and to improve retrieval by supplementing semantic matching.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve retrieval accuracy in theme-specific applications by effectively utilizing corpus topical taxonomies.

data.source: SCIDOCS dataset for academic paper search, Amazon ESCI dataset for product search
data.size: 25,657 documents for SCIDOCS, 601,354 documents for Amazon ESCI

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the number of relevant results retrieved and their ranks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in recall, NDCG, and MAP indicate better retrieval performance.
methodology.baseline_results: ToTER consistently improves retrieval metrics over existing methods in the evaluated domains.
